Class EmitComponent

java.lang.Object
  edu.luc.cs.trull.EmptyComponent
      edu.luc.cs.trull.TerminatingComponent
          edu.luc.cs.trull.AbstractComponent
              edu.luc.cs.trull.EmitComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, PropertyChangeSource, SchedulerAware, Startable, Suspendable, Terminating
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActionEventAdapter, ButtonComponent, ButtonReactor, Clock, ConsoleTester, ControlPanelUI, Counter, DateMode, Emit, Light, OccupantControl, OfficeUI, SetDay, SetHour, SetMinute, SetMonth, SetPower, SwingTester, Thermostat, TimeMode, TimerController.SetTime, TimerDemo, Translation, Update, UserInterface, WindowShip
public class EmitComponent
extends AbstractComponent

A superclass or delegation support class for components that require preemptable and suspendable event emission. To schedule events for emission, subclasses should use the scheduleEvent methods from within lifecycle or event handling methods. If this component is stopped before the event has been fired, the event will not be fired at all. If the component is suspended before the event has been fired, the event will not be fired until the component is resumed.

See Also:
Startable, Suspendable

eventEmitter

protected final java.lang.Runnable eventEmitter(java.lang.String label,
                                                java.lang.Object value,
                                                boolean terminate)
Returns a Runnable for event emission. This emitter behaves as follows: if no longer alive, the event is discarded. If suspended, the emitter adds itself to the suspended queue. Upon resuming, the component reschedules the events on the suspend queue.

Returns:
the event emitter.

scheduleEvent

public void scheduleEvent(java.lang.String label)
Schedules an event with the given properties for emission. Used by subclasses when events must not be fired directly to preserve sequential, non-overlapping processing of events; this usually happens when a component emits an event in response to an incoming event.

Parameters:
label - the label (property name) of the event.

scheduleEvent

public void scheduleEvent(java.lang.String label,
                          java.lang.Object value)
Schedules an event with the given properties for emission. Used by subclasses when events must not be fired directly to preserve sequential, non-overlapping processing of events; this usually happens when a component emits an event in response to an incoming event.

Parameters:
label - the label (property name) of the event.
value - the data value (new property value) of the event.

scheduleEvent

protected void scheduleEvent(java.lang.String label,
                             java.lang.Object value,
                             boolean terminate)
Schedules an event with the given properties for emission. Used by subclasses when events must not be fired directly to preserve sequential, non-overlapping processing of events; this usually happens when a component emits an event in response to an incoming event.

Parameters:
label - the label (property name) of the event.
value - the data value (new property value) of the event.
terminate - whether the component should also request termination immediately after scheduling the event for emission.
